intro: Calceolaria bellidifolia var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. It is a perennial herb that produces showy blooms during the spring and early summer. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts for its striking appearance.
